feed.title: Current Watches, Warnings and Advisories for the United States Issued by the National Weather Service

entry.title: Winter Storm Warning issued December 21 at 2:25PM AKST until December 22 at 6:00PM AKST by NWS
entry.summary: ...WINTER STORM WARNING IN EFFECT FROM 6 PM THIS EVENING TO 6 PM AKST WEDNESDAY... * WHAT...Heavy snow and blowing snow expected. Travel will be very difficult to impossible. Total snow accumulations of 6 to 9 inches are expected. * WHERE...Yukon Delta.

entry.summary: ...BLIZZARD WARNING IN EFFECT FROM 6 PM THIS EVENING TO 9 PM AKST WEDNESDAY... * WHAT...Blizzard conditions expected. Travel will be very difficult to impossible. Total snow accumulations of 4 to 7 inches, with localized amounts up to 10 inches, are expected. * WHERE...St Lawrence Island and Bering Strait Coast.
entry.cap:areaDesc: St Lawrence Island and Bering Strait Coast

entry.title: Special Weather Statement issued December 21 at 2:14PM AKST by NWS
entry.summary: ...More Snow For the Interior Wednesday Night... Another weather front will move into the Interior Wednesday evening, with snow reaching the Fairbanks area by Wednesday night. entry.title: Special Weather Statement issued December 21 at 2:59PM PST by NWS
entry.summary: ...WINTER WEATHER WILL RESULT IN MAJOR TRAVEL DISRUPTIONS THROUGH THE HOLIDAY WEEKEND... Starting late Tuesday night and lasting through the holiday weekend, a series of systems will bring stormy weather to the Sierra, northeast California, and western Nevada. There may be a period with lighter snowfall for the Sierra on Christmas Eve

entry.title: Flood Watch issued December 21 at 11:30AM PST by NWS
entry.summary: .Heavy rain over the south slopes of the Olympics Tuesday night through Wednesday could drive the Skokomish River in Mason county above flood stage Wednesday evening through Thursday afternoon. ...FLOOD WATCH NOW IN EFFECT FROM WEDNESDAY AFTERNOON THROUGH THURSDAY AFTERNOON...

entry.title: Special Weather Statement issued December 21 at 6:22AM PST by NWS
entry.summary: ...COLDER AIR IS ON THE WAY - JUST IN TIME FOR THE HOLIDAYS... Today marks the first day of winter, and the forecast is looking increasingly wintry for southwest Washington and northwest Oregon as we head into the Christmas weekend and next week. While the details remain uncertain, confidence is increasing that a prolonged period of below normal temperatures will begin this
